stone.util

Class TaskPool

  • java.lang.Object
    • stone.util.TaskPool

  • public class TaskPool
extends java.lang.Object
    Simple thread management.
    Author:
    Nelphindal

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      TaskPool(StartupContainer os)
      Creates a new task Pool

    • Constructor Detail

      • TaskPool

        public TaskPool(StartupContainer os)
        Creates a new task Pool
        Parameters:

    • Method Detail

      • addTask

        public final void addTask(java.lang.Runnable task)
        Adds a new task to the pool to be executed.
        Parameters:
        task -

      • addTaskForAll

        public final void addTaskForAll(java.lang.Runnable... tasks)
        Adds one or more tasks to the pool to be executed. Each task will be executed by each WorkerThread currently knwon to the pool. The next task will be executed after the previous task has been completed with all threads.
        Parameters:
        tasks -

      • close

        public final void close()
        Closes this pool. All waiting tasks will be woken up.

      • getMaster

        public final MasterThread getMaster()
        Returns:
        The thread which is interrupted if any operation catches an InterruptedException

      • runMaster

        public final void runMaster()
        Forks and starts the master thread.

      • waitForTasks

        public final void waitForTasks()
        Waits for the queue to be emptied and all tasks finished being executed. The master thread has to be checked if it was not interrupted while waiting.
